item.title: Tasmanian private mental health service The Hobart Clinic reopens after 17-day closure
item.description: A $2 million transitional funding injection from the Tasmanian government has allowed The Hobart Clinic to treat patients for six more months while it comes up with a sustainable business model.

item.title: Jury in trial of Rajwinder Singh, charged with murder of Toyah Cordingley, taken to beach where her body was found
item.description: The jury was taken by bus to Wangetti Beach, north of Cairns, where Ms Cordingley's body was found buried in a shallow sand grave in 2018.

item.title: South African man who attended Neo-Nazi rally outside NSW parliament has visa cancelled
item.description: The federal government has revoked the visa of a man who attended the far-right National Socialist Network protest at NSW's parliament house.

item.title: Australian beef producers welcome end to Donald Trump's import tariffs
item.description: Shoppers at home and abroad are unlikely to see any immediate change in the price of Australian beef as tariffs that did little to curb demand in the first place are lifted.

item.title: Quick and easy summer dinners
item.description: The busy end of year calls for simple dinners that are ready in 35 minutes or less.

item.title: Dozens of Canberra schools to reopen, 25 remain closed over coloured sand asbestos contamination concerns
item.description: Dozens of public schools in the ACT will reopen or partially open on Tuesday, but 25 remain closed for all students.

item.title: Offenders 'targeting' elderly residents at home in series of assaults in Alice Springs
item.description: Three elderly Alice Springs residents have been assaulted at their Sadadeen homes within a 10-day period this month.

item.title: Black swan 'Jandal' released in Alice Springs after recovering from suspected dog attack
item.description: An unlikely patient in Alice Springs is returned to the water treatment ponds two weeks after being found injured from a suspected dog attack.

item.title: Man sentenced over 'disgusting' death threats to Senator Fatima Payman
item.description: A Victorian court has sentenced a man to a community corrections order after he sent death threats to Australian senator Fatima Payman via email.

item.title: Brendan Doggett poised for Test cricket debut in first Ashes Test against England
item.description: Fast bowler Brendan Doggett says he learned he could make a Test debut while waiting to bat in South Australia's Sheffield Shield run chase last week against Tasmania.

item.title: Mary Fowler's resilience in face of mental health struggles hailed by Matildas coach Joe Montemurro
item.description: Mary Fowler is unlikely to be back on the pitch with the Matildas until next year at the earliest, but coach Joe Montemurro is making sure to stay in close contact.

item.title: Several Tasmanian non-government schools closed, others partially closed due to coloured sand recall
item.description: At least six non-government schools have closed, and six others partially closed on Monday due to the national recall of coloured sand products over asbestos contamination, with others slated for closure on Tuesday.

item.title: Foreign minister says Labor's 'landmark' agreements builds more stable Asia-Pacific
item.description: The foreign minister has used a major speech to celebrate the government's string of security agreements, saying Labor has helped build a region more stable and less deferential to authoritarian powers like Russia and China.

item.title: Pat Cummins completes bowling session before first Ashes Test
item.description: Australia captain Pat Cummins completes a full bowling session at training just four days before the start of the Ashes.

item.title: Rio Tinto scraps $215m research centre and BioIron product after decade of development
item.description: Mining giant Rio Tinto scraps a $215 million research centre and green steel project touted last year as a key staging ground for the world's net zero transition.

item.title: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley guarantees she will remain leader until next election
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley may be under siege, but says she has no doubts she will remain party leader until the next federal election.

item.title: Explosion on Polish railway line to Ukraine an act of sabotage, Polish PM says
item.description: The track is a vital link for supplies to reach Ukraine, with the incident the latest in a wave of similar attacks across Europe since Russia's invasion began.

item.title: Australian man Johnson Wen jailed after grabbing Ariana Grande at Wicked: For Good premiere
item.description: Johnson Wen, who is alleged to have disrupted other global sports events and concerts, has shown "a pattern of behaviour", according to a Singapore court judge.

item.title: BBC 'determined to fight' looming Trump lawsuit over speech edit
item.description: The US president says he could sue the British national broadcaster for as much as $US5 billion.

item.title: Five Ukrainians killed and kindergarten destroyed in latest Russian strikes, as Zelenskyy signs French fighter jets deal
item.description: Moscow is intensifying its strikes on Ukraine, targeting the country's energy infrastructure ahead of winter.

item.title: The Ashes quiz: Test your knowledge ahead of the 2025/26 Ashes Test
item.description: Ahead of the 2025/26 Ashes series getting underway on November 21 in Perth, test out your knowledge in our fiendish Ashes quiz.

item.title: What price power? How electricity became a political weapon
item.description: A decade and a half after an energy company CEO outlined his greatest fears for Australia's economic future — no carbon price — the nation again appears set for a renewed battle over climate policy and power generation.

item.title: How Russia is ramping up its efforts to take strategic Ukrainian city Pokrovsk
item.description: Recently released video shows a "Mad Max-style" convoy entering Pokrovsk in Ukraine's east on motorcycles and in ramshackle cars, in what experts say is part of Russia's latest push to take the city.

item.title: Nirvana’s MTV Unplugged: How a near-disaster became an iconic live performance
item.description: It was nearly a disaster, but Nirvana going acoustic for MTV ended up being one of the most iconic live performances ever and cemented Kurt Cobain as a tortured genius.

item.title: Lost at sea: The harrowing hours of the deadliest Sydney to Hobart race
item.description: The fleet of the 1998 Sydney to Hobart yacht race set sail from the harbour city, unaware they were travelling directly into the path of a huge storm and unrelenting swell that would throw the race into disarray and claim six lives.

item.title: Renewable energy generators need to cut supply to stay sustainable. Here's why
item.description: When there is an oversupply of solar and wind power, energy producers are paying more to deliver electricity to households than they get paid. Here's what we know about how it affects you.

item.title: Inside the AFL's infamous 2020 'COVID draft' as teams and players battled impacts of lockdowns
item.description: It is the AFL draft that has become a cautionary tale to clubs. Five years on from the infamous 2020 draft, here is the story on the tumultuous year from those involved in it.

item.title: 'Aussie Cossack' Simeon Boikov says staff at Russia's Sydney consulate are trying to push him out
item.description: Simeon Boikov, the pro-Putin propagandist hiding from authorities in the Russian consulate in Sydney, launches an extraordinary attack on his hosts, saying they are subjecting him to "prison-like conditions" in a bid to "push me out".

item.title: The long road to the House of Representatives vote on the Epstein files
item.description: The US House of Representatives is poised to take a significant step in the mammoth saga of the so-called "Epstein files". Here's how we got there.

item.title: Rio Tinto pauses plans for $3.7b lithium mine but Serbians remain concerned
item.description: Rio Tinto may have mothballed its proposed $3.6 billion lithium project in Serbia's Jadar Valley, but opponents have vowed to keep fighting until the mining giant leaves the area for good.

item.title: Figures show areas with high Indigenous populations have more poker machines
item.description: New figures show there are 50 per cent more pokies in areas with an Indigenous population of at least 10 per cent. Gambling groups say it is "not surprising".

item.title: Queensland parents divided on recall of decorative sand over contamination concerns
item.description: While some Queensland parents are angered by the nationwide recall of coloured sand that may have traces of asbestos, others are less concerned.

item.title: Businesses urge Labor and Coalition to 'work together' on environmental reform
item.description: The next few days are viewed as critical to landing a deal on the proposed reforms to update the EPBC Act, amid hopes the Liberals will be more motivated to bolster their environmental credentials after ditching net zero.

item.title: Contest over Canberra man Michael O'Connell's murder charge, manslaughter or freedom heads to High Court
item.description: In 2022, a woman died after being run over by a ute outside her house. The legal case about exactly what happened and who's responsible is now heading to the High Court.

item.title: Slain paramedic Steven Tougher's wife speaks out on mental health, a year after killer was detained
item.description: One year after Steven Tougher's killer was found not criminally responsible due to mental impairment, his wife says she has learnt to accept it.

item.title: Tasmanian duo Beau Webster, Jake Weatherald vie for Ashes Test spot in Perth
item.description: Teammates for Tasmania, Beau Webster and Jake Weatherald will be locked in a battle to play for Australia in the first Test of the Ashes.

item.title: Alex Greenwich moves to fast track medicinal cannabis driving reforms in NSW
item.description: Independent Sydney MP Alex Greenwich says it is time to "get the ball rolling" on medical cannabis reforms in NSW.

item.title: Landowner concerned about site rehabilitation as Murray Zircon shuts operations
item.description: A mine in South Australia's Murray Mallee is ceasing operations and says it will rehabilitate the site back to its original condition. However, the site's owner says the land will never get back to what it was before mining.

item.title: Darebin asks AFL for lifeline as club faces financial pressure to stay in VFLW
item.description: Darebin nurtured AFLW stars Daisy Pearce and Darcy Vescio, but financial constraints could force the independent club out of the VFLW.

item.title: Lleyton Hewitt's Davis Cup win over Rodger Federer saw off AFL switch
item.description: An epic Davis Cup win over Roger Federer in 2003 convinced Australian tennis great Lleyton Hewitt to not go ahead with a stunning career change. Two-time grand slam champion Hewitt is one of seven inductees into the Sport Australia Hall of Fame.

item.title: Judge finds 'profound' missteps in Trump-appointed attorney's James Comey probe
item.description: Donald Trump's critics describe Mr Comey's charges as part of a campaign by the president to chill opposition.

item.title: UN Security Council backs US plan for an international stabilisation force in Gaza
item.description: The UN Security Council approves a US plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force to provide security in the devastated territory.

item.title: TPG Telecom says Sydney person died after outdated phone software blocked Triple Zero calls
item.description: TPG Telecom says a Sydney customer died after outdated software blocked a Samsung phone from making Triple Zero calls.

item.title: Emotional scenes at Moss Vale site hearing over proposed plastics factory
item.description: Normally confined to four walls, the Land and Environment Court holds a site hearing in the NSW Southern Highlands to hear residents' concerns about a proposed recycling plant.

item.title: When is the ARIAs awards ceremony? Where can I watch it?
item.description: The Australian music industry awards will be celebrating some of the best acts in the country this week.

item.title: Donald Trump says he will sign bill to release Epstein files if it passes Congress
item.description: The bill — to direct the US Justice Department to release its documents about late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein — now looks set to sail through the House of Representatives.

item.title: Coloured sand is being disposed of across the country due to asbestos contamination concerns. How much risk does it actually pose?
item.description: Dozens of schools remain closed in the ACT, Tasmania and South Australia today as the clean-up and disposal of potentially asbestos-laced coloured sand continues. What risk does it actually pose?

item.title: Lachlan Young sentenced to 28 years' jail for murdering Hannah McGuire in Ballarat
item.description: Lachlan Young strangled Ms McGuire in their Sebastopol home, then placed her body in her ute and set it alight in bushland on Ballarat's outskirts, staging the scene to look like a suicide.

item.title: Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua's boxing match is a dangerous betrayal of the sport
item.description: Nobody plays at boxing. But Jake Paul's upcoming contest against a bona fide, former two-time unified heavyweight champion of the world smacks of a game about to go seriously wrong.

item.title: Asbestos scare widens as more than 350 SA schools detect recalled sand
item.description: The number of public education sites in South Australia that have reported coloured sand linked to an asbestos contamination scare rises above 350, but authorities say there is no plan for closures at this stage.

item.title: Man shot by police in Cairns after reportedly approaching them with a knife
item.description: Police have shot a man in Far North Queensland after he reportedly approached them armed with a knife.

item.title: Sydney father who pleaded guilty to murdering 3yo son to be sentenced next month
item.description: The 48-year-old man pleaded guilty to murdering his three-year-old son in a unit in Sydney's south-west two years ago.

item.title: More schools reopen in Canberra on Wednesday as coloured sand clean-up continues
item.description: More schools have reopened in Canberra, with a list of current closures to be updated today.

item.title: AFL draft 2025 club by club preview: Your team's picks and potential targets
item.description: With the AFL draft just around the corner, see which picks each club has to work with and the players they could select.

item.title: Cyclists, pedestrians diverted to Causeway amid closure of Boorloo Bridge in Perth
item.description: The Boorloo Bridge, which connects Perth's inner southern suburbs with the CBD, will remain closed until Thursday after lighting fell from the structure.

item.title: Category two cyclone predicted off NT coast by Thursday
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology has issued its first forecast track map for a tropical low over the NT, showing the system is expected to strengthen into a category two cyclone by Thursday night.

item.title: Legal Aid NT to stop taking on new criminal cases due to funding shortfall
item.description: Legal Aid NT says it will refuse all new criminal clients who are not already in custody, including children as young as 10, due to funding constraints.

item.title: Off-duty pilot who tried to cut a flight's engines midair will not serve additional prison time
item.description: A US judge has ruled that a former Alaska Airlines pilot who tried to disable the engines of a passenger jet mid-flight while riding off-duty in the cockpit will not serve additional prison time.

item.title: The Australian music groups celebrating major milestone anniversaries in 2025
item.description: Improvising with headlights, a sold-out debut and championing new music are some of the impacts these Australian music groups have made in their decades-long existence.

item.title: Gippsland's Willem Duursma set to become fourth family member to join AFL/AFLW
item.description: Willem Duursma's dancing feet could carry him all the way to the number-one pick at tomorrow night's AFL National Draft.

item.title: CFMEU inquiry hears 'cycle of lawlessness' and violence operated in Queensland
item.description: A probe into the CFMEU has begun in Brisbane, examining allegations of bullying, violence and misogyny at the powerful construction union.

item.title: Eli Katoa to miss 2026 NRL season after Melbourne Storm star's brain surgery
item.description: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa will miss the 2026 NRL season as he continues his recovery from head knocks that forced him to have brain surgery.

item.title: Vanuatu council repeals law banning menstruating women from selling food
item.description: A Vanuatu provincial government says it will repeal parts of its new bylaw banning menstruating women from preparing and selling food at markets and roadside stalls after the decision sparked a public outcry.

item.title: Asbestos contamination of children's sand was a fluke discovery in an Australian lab
item.description: An Australian lab discovered asbestos in children's play sand by chance and regulators only found out about it because of a podcast interview, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Inside The Hood Contender, Australia's controversial amateur fighting competition trying to save men's lives
item.description: The organiser of this fight club says it saves lives. But critics say it is putting young men at serious risk.

item.title: CSIRO to cut up to 350 research jobs in major overhaul
item.description: After 440 positions were slashed last year, the CSIRO has announced more staff cuts across the country in a bid to remain financially viable.

item.title: Alleged manslaughter victim had cuts, bruises and off-smelling school lunches, court told
item.description: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had attended school with bruises and had lunches that "didn't seem" edible, a court has heard.

item.title: Court hears details of Dawood Zakaria murder as man charged over attack denied bail
item.description: Details of how a Sydney underworld figure was tracked by his would-be killers have been revealed for the first time in court as it emerged a 19-year-old charged vowed to an associate: "brother I would never snitch".

item.title: Brisbane Lions recruit Neasa Dooley wanting to add more Irish success in AFLW preliminary final against Carlton Blues
item.description: No stranger to the big stage, Brisbane's Neasa Dooley wants a piece of what her fellow Irish imports have been selling.

item.title: What it's like being a male early childhood educator amid the childcare crisis
item.description: While the childcare crisis has left me concerned about my own child's safety, as a male early childhood educator, I'm also worried about the future of men in the sector, writes Ben.

item.title: Parents in 'childcare desert' left scrambling as Playtime Preschool enters voluntary administration
item.description: One of the few childcare operators in Broken Hill has closed its doors indefinitely with 24 hours warning after entering voluntary administration.

item.title: Rajwinder Singh, charged with the murder of Toyah Cordingley, was 'very stressed' on day body found, court told
item.description: Rajwinder Singh, who has pleaded not guilty to the murder of 24-year-old Toyah Cordingley, is on trial in the Supreme Court in Cairns.

item.title: Defence inspector inadvertently omitted 10 consultations held with NACC chief Paul Brereton
item.description: A previous disclosure that the head of the federal corruption watchdog had been consulted 11 times has been corrected to 21.

item.title: Victorian Liberals' first female leader Jess Wilson must prove the party is worth fighting for
item.description: Victoria's first female Liberal Party leader is facing a gargantuan task to unite her party and prove the opposition is worth voting for, Richard Willingham writes.

item.title: BlueScope AGM held in shadow of Port Kembla steelworks fatality, minute’s silence held
item.description: Shareholders and executives observe a minute's silence at BlueScope's AGM for the young worker killed at Port Kembla steelworks.

item.title: Sydney waste water likely origin of debris on Central Coast beaches
item.description: Sydney Water is working to determine the source of high levels of grease and oil that caused debris balls to wash up on beaches across Sydney and the Central Coast.

item.title: COP30 decision by South Korea to shut down coal a reckoning for Australian exports
item.description: In a move that has been welcomed by climate campaigners, South Korea has vowed to phase out coal, sparking a warning for Australian exporters.

item.title: Numerous Tasmanian public, Catholic and independent schools to close from Wednesday
item.description: More than 50 Tasmanian schools will either close or be partially closed from Wednesday in response to ongoing public health concerns relating to asbestos in coloured sand.

item.title: Remote Aboriginal community of Tjuntjuntjara challenges local government election result
item.description: A remote Aboriginal corporation lodges a formal dispute over the outcome of a local government election decided by just one vote.

item.title: WA Police reveal number plate recognition trial in operation at Westfield Carousel
item.description: Cameras that record the number plates of all the vehicles that enter one of Perth's biggest shopping centres are being used to track criminals, WA police have revealed.

item.title: Grisly crime scene described to courtroom in Jodie Hill's Dimboola murder trial
item.description: Dimboola woman Jodie Hill's murder trial has begun in the Supreme Court over the death of John Hunter.

item.title: Senator Fatima Payman calls on prime minister to denounce online trolls
item.description: After the man who threatened her life via email was sentenced in court earlier this week, Senator Fatima Payman is being targeted by online abuse.

item.title: Most restrictive abortion bill in the US being considered
item.description: Restrictions on IUDs and IVF and decades of imprisonment for having an abortion could become the reality for some women living in South Carolina if the legislation passes.

item.title: Woman jailed for stabbing AFP officer with pen at Perth Airport
item.description: A woman who stabbed a federal police officer at Perth Airport with a pen in a "vicious" attack is sentenced to more than two years in prison.

item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: P-plater in unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle jailed over fatal crash which killed cyclist
item.description: A P-plater in an uninsured, unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle hit and killed a cyclist last year. Today, he was jailed.

item.title: Woman 'devastated' after alleged violent offender released into community without tracker
item.description: The former partner of a man accused of raping and strangling her says she fears for her life after he was released on bail without a GPS tracking device.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese heralds WA gallium project as 'game changing'
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visits the future West Australian gallium processing plant site, central to the United States critical minerals deal, heralding it as a "game changing" project.

item.title: Public hospitals wasting $1.2b a year and hindered by 'bogus budgets', Grattan Institute says
item.description: A new report recommends Australia’s public hospitals stop wasting money and adopt efficiency measures seen in other countries amid governmental tensions over a new funding deal.

item.title: Poland says Russian intelligence likely behind railway sabotage
item.description: Polish authorities say "everything indicates" Russian involvement in a blast along a railway line used to transport goods to Ukraine, as they identify two people believed to be responsible.

item.title: Japan warns citizens in China to be careful as diplomatic spat continues over Taiwan
item.description: Authorities have told Japanese people in China to avoid large crowds, as tensions between Tokyo and Beijing continue to simmer.

item.title: Roblox promises age checks as Australia's under-16 social media ban looms
item.description: The company says age verification checks will start in early December, around the same time Australia's social media ban for under-16s is set to come into effect.

item.title: Jess Wilson is the Victorian Liberals’ survival strategy. Are federal Liberals listening?
item.description: The Liberals in two big Australian states are realigning themselves — shifting to what Sussan Ley once described as the sensible centre.

item.title: Booker Prize quiz: Test your knowledge of the prestigious book award
item.description: The prestigious Booker Prize, worth $100,000, announced its 2025 winner last week. Do you remember who won? Test your knowledge of the world's favourite book awards with our quiz.

item.description: Innovative motion controls and accessible design made the Nintendo Wii one of the most popular consoles of all time.

item.title: Dud superannuation options could cost retirees up to $205,000, Super Consumers warns
item.description: Superannuation products that fail the federal government's performance test are still offered to those already retired at a potentially huge cost, according to the consumer advocate.

item.title: Australia's weapons programs exposed in defence industry cyber attacks
item.description: Information relating to Australian military programs has been compromised in cyber attacks on defence industry contractors, exposing security vulnerabilities along supply chains.

item.description: There are growing questions about whether one of Australia's largest telcos could have done more to ensure customers would be able to call Triple Zero.

item.description: As Donald Trump's plan for Gaza gets UN approval, the proposals for how the territory might be developed are circulating and advocates are worried about who they ultimately benefit.

item.title: How often should you pay your mortgage to save?
item.description: Switching to fortnightly repayments from monthly — if you can afford it — can help you pay down your mortgage faster. Here’s why.

item.description: Horse trainer Tony McEvoy returned to his hometown of Streaky Bay, on South Australia's west coast, with trophies in tow after his horse Half Yours' recent wins at the Caulfield and Melbourne cups.

item.description: A fire-resistant mesh is being used to protect thousands of wooden power poles from bushfires across the NSW Central Coast and Hunter regions.

item.description: The ABC Radio Melbourne breakfast co-host and her husband say they are overjoyed but terrified as they prepare for the birth of their baby girl in March.

item.description: Wallabies outside centre Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii is recognised for his performances since switching codes from rugby league late last year.

item.description: Once the site of the worst commercial nuclear power accident in the US, Pennsylvania's Three Mile Island will again start producing electricity after the Department of Energy agreed to a $US1 billion ($1.5 billion) loan.

item.title: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic fumes at penalty decision in 3-0 friendly loss to Colombia in New York
item.description: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic laments a "disappointing" penalty decision as the Socceroos fall to a 3-0 loss to Colombia in New York.

item.title: Now that US Congress has voted to release the Jeffrey Epstein files, here is what happens next
item.description: The Epstein Files Transparency Act sailed through both the US House of Representatives and the Senate in a single Washington afternoon. This is how we got here, and what could happen next.

item.title: Through dust and drought, these women are redefining resilience
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: CSIRO chief defends job cuts amid fears for growth of scientific research in Australia
item.description: The chief executive of the CSIRO has defended the decision to cut hundreds of jobs, arguing the organisation needs to alter its priorities to remain relevant.

item.title: Adelaide University co-vice chancellors share complexities of uni merger
item.description: The co-vice chancellors of the new Adelaide University says the mammoth task of merging two universities has its own complexities.

item.title: ACT joins SA in calls for urgent national inquiry into how asbestos sand entered Australia
item.description: The SA and ACT education ministers are calling for a national inquiry into how coloured play sand contaminated with asbestos was imported into the country, with more than 450 SA Department for Education sites now impacted.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Elon Musk among special guests at dinner with Donald Trump and Saudi crown prince
item.description: Elon Musk made his first visit to the White House since leaving his role in the Trump administration earlier this year.

item.title: Fire engulfs residential area of Oita, Japan
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Fire races through 170 buildings in southern Japan, one person missing
item.description: The fire broke out during strong winds on Tuesday evening near a fishing port in the city of Oita and spread to a forest.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Singapore's world-first sustainable flights tax will see some Australians pay more to travel
item.description: Passenger flights from Singapore are set to become more costly after the announcement of a world-first sustainable fuel tax to be included in travellers' ticket prices.

item.title: Man clings to bonnet in road rage attack
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Mildura motorcyclist loses licence after road rage bonnet ride to police station
item.description: A road rage attack in which a motorcyclist rode a P-plater's bonnet all the way to a police station costs him his licence for eight months.

item.title: ARIAs 2025 red carpet: Olivia Dean, Emma Watkins, Abbie Chatfield and Tkay Maidza
item.description: The best and brightest on the Australian music scene have gathered at Sydney's Hordern Pavilion. Here's a wrap of the awards show looks.

item.title: Radio titan John Laws farewelled at state funeral at Sydney cathedral
item.description: Family, politicians and the who's who of Australian broadcasting have gathered at Sydney's St Andrew's Cathedral to farewell the legendary John Laws.

item.title: Tony Award winner Marg Horwell turns classic opera into technicolour spectacle in Carmen
item.description: Growing up, Aussie Marg Horwell wanted to be an actor, but soon found she had an affinity for set and costume design that has taken her to Broadway.

item.title: Tim Tszyu's next fight confirmed for Sydney against undefeated American Anthony Velasquez
item.description: After losing three of his past four fights, Tim Tszyu's next bout will be in Sydney as the 31-year old attempts to bring his career back from the brink.

item.title: ABC managing director tells journalists not to 'second-guess' their work
item.description: In an address to the National Press Club, Hugh Marks says he inherited a "fearfulness" within the public broadcaster but that it is improving in its response to mistakes and external scrutiny.

item.title: Anthony Albanese says no apology over Border Force's secret boat returnee scheme
item.description: Anthony Albanese is refusing to be drawn on how much a program to remove people from Australia's northern waters using repurposed fishing boats is costing, saying it is a legacy project.

item.title: Man clings to bonnet in road rage attack
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Only three schools to remain closed in the ACT while 13 partially open as asbestos clean-up continues
item.description: One school which had earlier been re-opened will now be closed for the rest of the week.

item.title: Aerial vision after fire engulfs residential area of Oita, Japan
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: One missing, around 175 evacuated as fire engulfs neighbourhood in Oita, Japan
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Klimt portrait sets record while gold toilet fetches millions at New York auction
item.description: A portrait by Gustav Klimt fetched a record price at a New York auction, which also sold a fully functional gold toilet, a satirical artwork by Maurizio Cattelan, for millions.

item.title: ARIAs 2025: Stars arrive for Australian music's night of nights — as it happened
item.description: Amyl and the Sniffers took home four awards, including Album of the Year, while Missy Higgins and Ninajirachi also claimed gongs at this year's ARIAs.

item.title: Curaçao and Haiti defy the odds to secure qualification for 2026 FIFA World Cup
item.description: With a population of just over 150,000, the Caribbean island nation of Curaçao will become the smallest nation ever to play at the World Cup after a scoreless draw with Jamaica secured its passage to next year's tournament.

item.title: Cyclone Fina tracker map: When it will hit NT coastline
item.description: The system has the potential to make landfall on the Northern Territory coast by Friday.

item.title: Court hears from loved ones before driver who caused Matthew McLuckie's death is sentenced
item.description: A court prepares to sentence a speeding, drug-affected driver who was on the wrong side of the road before a fatal crash.

item.title: Social housing tenant facing eviction after DV noise complaints wins right to stay
item.description: A mother who was facing eviction from her social housing home after complaints from neighbours will be allowed to stay, after a court finds the incidents mostly stemmed from her domestic violence abuse.

item.title: Have the Epstein files 'ripped MAGA apart'? Maybe not, but there will be fallout
item.description: Before the Epstein files vote, Washington woke to a zero-degree morning, and Marjorie Taylor Greene could see the symbolism. "My first thought was: hell has froze over," she said.

item.title: States launch coordinated attack on federal handling of public hospital negotiations
item.description: State and territory leaders hold an emergency meeting over public hospital funding, declaring they cannot sacrifice hospital care to bolster the Commonwealth's finances.

item.title: Glenn McGrath and ABC Sport part ways over cricket great's links with gambling company
item.description: ABC Sport and Australian cricketing legend Glenn McGrath part ways due to the former fast bowler's relationship with a betting company.

item.title: Frank Moneger denied bail over alleged hit-and-run which left 17-year-old girl dead
item.description: Police allege in court 58-year-old Frank Moneger sent a voicemail saying he had "killed someone" after the crash, which left a teenage girl dead.

item.title: ARIA Awards 2025 winners' list: every winner at this year's ceremony
item.description: Catch up on all the trophy winners at the 2025 ARIA Awards, which took place at Sydney's Hordern Pavilion.

item.title: Perth man Adam McGovern trial begins on dozens of indecent recording charges
item.description: Adam Simon McGovern, 50, goes on trial in Perth, accused of dozens of charges of indecent recording women and girls on public transport and in supermarkets.

item.title: New survey reveals mass coral death at Ningaloo Reef as critical summer looms
item.description: Scientists say they are "speechless" after witnessing significant coral death at the World Heritage-listed Ningaloo Reef.

item.title: Australia's eSafety Commissioner called to testify before US Congress and labelled a 'zealot'
item.description: Australia's online safety regulator, Julie Inman Grant, has been labelled a "zealot" and called to testify before US Congress, over concerns her office is censoring the internet for Americans.

item.title: North Queensland mother faces court over four-year-old son's death
item.description: Lawyers for a North Queensland mother charged with the murder of toddler Tarrin-Macen O'Sullivan are arguing the post-mortem investigation does not rule out other causes of death.

item.title: As the clean-up of coloured sand continues, how long will Tasmanian schools to be closed for?
item.description: Thirteen public schools will remain closed on Thursday, and another 22 will remain partially closed. Several non-government schools are also closed or partially closed as education authorities respond to the recall of coloured sand products found to contain traces of asbestos.

item.title: AFL draft 2025 first round recap: Willem Duursma joins Eagles as Suns and Bombers emerge big winners
item.description: West Coast emerges from the 2025 AFL draft with the crown jewel in Willem Duursma as Gold Coast and Essendon beef up their playing lists with a combined seven first-round selections.

item.title: Ipswich Mayor Teresa Harding says the odours mean she can't have friends over in her garden
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Odours from Ipswich industrial estates, west of Brisbane, are offensive and negatively impact residents, inquiry finds
item.description: Residents who have been raising concerns about the odours for more than a decade say the findings have vindicated what they have been saying all along.

item.title: WA environment minister green-lights $300 million Cockatoo Island aviation and marine hub
item.description: A $300 million multi-user supply base is set to be built on Cockatoo Island, off the northern West Australian coast.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Court hears 72-year-old man found genitally mutilated, eyes gouged, with pictures etched in skin
item.description: A Victorian court hears that an elderly man was found dead in 2023, missing his genitals and covered in etchings from a box cutter.

item.title: John Torney to be committed to stand trial over alleged negligent manslaughter of Emma Bates
item.description: A Victorian magistrate has indicated that a 41-year-old man charged with manslaughter over the death of Cobram woman Emma Bates will be committed to stand trial.

item.title: Perth man charged after investigation into organised crime and tobacco store attacks
item.description: Police charge a 31-year-old man they allege is at the helm of an organised crime syndicate distributing black market tobacco in Perth.

item.title: Mary Fowler reveals she experienced depression, self-harm and racism during time with French club Montpellier
item.description: Socceroos star Mary Fowler says she dealt with depression and self-harm, as well as racism from her teammates during her time with Montpellier.

item.title: PFAS inquiry hands down 47 recommendations to better regulate 'forever chemicals' in Australia
item.description: The federal inquiry into "forever chemicals" has asked the federal government to review its health advice on PFAS in light of the growing international consensus of its health risks.

item.title: SA opposition pledges $21m fishing licence buyback amid toxic algal bloom
item.description: The South Australian opposition has pledged a $21-million voluntary fisheries buyback scheme, if it is elected next year, to allow commercial fishers to leave the industry amid the harmful algal bloom.

item.title: Cricket’s oldest rivalry begins again
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Family that used potentially asbestos-contaminated coloured sand at Diwali want clear action points
item.description: A Canberra mother who used coloured sand to celebrate Diwali in her backyard wants more help from WorkSafe ACT after being advised to cordon off the area, a thoroughfare to her home, and call an asbestos company.

item.title: Footage of the infamous picket line clash between non-union workers and CFMEU members has been played.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former CFMEU boss sent abusive text to anti-corruption barrister and offered weight loss advice, inquiry hears
item.description: Geoffrey Watson SC, who authored a damning report into the CFMEU branch, has given evidence over two days at the inquiry.

item.title: Government canvasses Pacific leaders on backdown option for COP31
item.description: The federal government has begun to contact Pacific leaders to canvass a COP31 "Plan B" which would see Adelaide abandon its bid for the global United Nations climate summit so long as Pacific nations are guaranteed a role in next year's conference.

item.title: Police officer who tracked Toyah Cordingley's phone gives evidence at Rajwinder Singh's murder trial
item.description: Detective Sergeant Matt Mattock gives evidence about cars of interest in the investigation into the Far North Queensland woman's murder.

item.title: ARIA Awards 2025 winners: Amyl & The Sniffers and Ninajirachi dominate
item.description: The ARIAs belonged to two relative underdogs this year. Don't know who they are? It's time to pay attention.

item.title: Louvre Museum to add 100 external cameras by 2026 after heist exposed security flaws
item.description: French officials announce the Louvre will introduce extra security, including anti-intrusion devices and anti-vehicle ramming barriers on nearby public roads, by the end of the year.

item.title: Indonesia's Semeru volcano erupts prompting aviation warning in Australia
item.description: The eruption of Semeru on Java Island sent ash 2 kilometres into the sky and has prompted aviation warnings in Australia.

item.title: Meta to kick teens off Instagram and Facebook a week early as social media ban looms
item.description: Meta has begun giving hundreds of thousands of Australian teens a two-week warning to "download or delete" their data from Instagram, Facebook and Threads.

item.title: Russian barrage kills 25 in Ukraine city as Zelenskyy holds talks with Turkish leader
item.description: A Russian drone and missile barrage has killed 25 people, including two children, in a western Ukrainian city, around 200 kilometres from the Polish border.

item.title: Sussan Ley to call for urgent action on defence in Menzies Institute speech
item.description: The opposition leader will pledge to spend 3 per cent of GDP on defence during a speech at the Menzies Institute in Melbourne on Thursday.

item.title: Fire kills at least one person and damages 170 buildings in city of Oita in Japan
item.description: Authorities are still working to extinguish the blaze, which has spread to nearby woodland.

item.title: The EU's been accused of caving to big tech on AI regulation. Here's why
item.description: Artificial intelligence could be trained using the sensitive health data of European citizens under proposed changes to the EU's rules on the sector.

item.title: UK 'ready to act' as Russian spy ship nears British territory
item.description: The Russian vessel had directed lasers at pilots of surveillance aircraft monitoring its activities.
